  • CurrentFlowSolutionAxiStatic
  • View page source

CurrentFlowSolutionAxiStaticÔÉÅ

class pyrit.solution.CurrentFlowSolutionAxiStatic(description: str, potential: ndarray, axi_mesh: mesh.AxiMesh, tri_axi_nodal_shape_function: shapefunction.TriAxisymmetricNodalShapeFunction, regions: Regions, materials: Materials, excitations: Excitations)ÔÉÅ

Bases: StaticSolution

The solution of a stationary current problem in axisymmetric coordinates.

The corresponding problem class is CurrentFlowProblemAxiStatic.

Base class for the solution of static and harmonic, magnetic, axisymmetric solutions.

Parameters

  • description (str) ‚Äì A description of the problem.

  • axi_mesh (AxiMesh) ‚Äì A mesh object. See pyrit.mesh.AxiMesh.

  • tri_axi_nodal_shape_function (TriAxisymmetricNodalShapeFunction) ‚Äì A shape function object. See pyrit.shapefunction.TriAxisymmetricEdgeShapeFunction

  • regions (Regions) ‚Äì A regions object. See pyrit.regions.

  • materials (Materials) ‚Äì A materials object. See pyrit.materials.

  • excitations (Excitations) ‚Äì An excitations object. See pyrit.excitation.

List of attributes that are not saved

property potential: ndarrayÔÉÅ

The electric potential. These are the coefficients for the basis functions.

property e_field: ndarrayÔÉÅ

The electric field. Array with two values per mesh element.

property e_field_abs: ndarrayÔÉÅ

Absolute value of the electric field. Array with one value per mesh element.

property conductivity_per_element: ndarrayÔÉÅ

Electric conductivity per element. Array with one value per mesh element.

property current_density: ndarrayÔÉÅ

Electric current density. Array with two values per mesh element.

property joule_loss_power_density: ndarrayÔÉÅ

Joule loss power density. Array with one value per mesh element.

property load_vector_electric: coo_matrixÔÉÅ

The load vector.

property divgrad_matrix_sigma: coo_matrixÔÉÅ

The divgrad matrix for the conductivity.

property divgrad_matrix_sigmad: coo_matrixÔÉÅ

The divgrad matrix for the differential conductivity.

property joule_loss_powerÔÉÅ

The joule loss power in the whole domain.

Computes the absolute field.

Parameters

Returns

:raises ValueError : When the input array is not of one of ht expected shapes.:

static load(path: Union[str, Path]) → SolutionÔÉÅ

Load a solution.

Parameters

path (Union[str, Path]) ‚Äì The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information.

Returns

solution ‚Äì A solution instance.

Return type

Solution

save(path: Union[str, Path], ignore_attributes: Optional[List[str]] = None) → PathÔÉÅ

Saves the solution instance.

Parameters

  • path (Union[str, Path]) ‚Äì

    The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information. If the path contains a non-existing folder, this folder will be created.

  • ignore_attributes (List[str], optional) ‚Äì A list of attributes that are not included in the saved file. The default value is ignore_for_saving of the object.

Returns

path ‚Äì The path that was used for opening the file.

Return type

Path
